sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftCont.!description: Gives access to runtime draft handling for applications. Assuming state-less communication, each single data modification request (or change set in an OData $batch request) is a "mini-transaction", which saves data to the database. The class implements the transactional interaction patterns specified for OData services that support draft documents and provides methods for draft-specific actions, for example validate, prepare, activate. Additionally, it handles transactional request processing, ensures concurrency control and correct ETag handling. It provides access to the simple interaction patterns of runtime handling for drafts according to the draft specification. These can be combined as required by client applications. Additionally, error handling is provided to notify client implementations of error situations. The event fatalError is thrown, if fatal errors occur during execution of OData requests.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftController.

activateDraftEntity.!description: Submits changes to the back-end and activates a draft entity in the back-end.

parameters.bIsLenient: type: boolean, description: Set to true to activate the draft even if warnings exist
parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

isActiveEntity.!description: Checks whether an entity set is active. The entity set name is derived from the given binding context

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

destroy.!description: Frees all resources claimed during the life-time of this instance.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftController with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.BaseController.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

createEditDraftEntity.!description: Creates an edit draft in the back-end. Additionally, possible changes that have been collected on the client are sent to the back-end.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context
parameters.bPreserveChanges: type: boolean, description: Set to true to avoid the creation of a new draft when unsaved changes exist in the back-end

saveAndPrepareDraftEntity.!description: Submits changes to the back-end and prepares a draft entity in the back-end for later activation by invoking the preparation action.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context
parameters.mParameters: type: map, description: Parameters to control the behavior of the request

createNewDraftEntity.!description: Creates a new edit draft on the client and sends it to the back-end. Additionally, possible changes that have been collected on the client are sent to the back-end.
createNewDraftEntity.!type: fn(sEntitySet: String, sPath: String, vPredefinedValues?: Array | Object, bCanonicalRequest?: Boolean) -> Promise

parameters.sPath: type: string, description: Path identifying the new entity instance
parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set
parameters.bCanonicalRequest: type: boolean, description: information whether the canonicalRequest parameter should be set for the create request
parameters.vPredefinedValues: type: array|object, description: An array that specifies a set of properties or the entry

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftCont.!constructorDescription: Constructor for a new draft controller instance.

hasActiveEntity.!description: Checks whether an entity has an active entity associated.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftCont.!helpDescription: Gives access to runtime draft handling for applications. Assuming state-less communication, each single data modification request (or change set in an OData $batch request) is a "mini-transaction", which saves data to the database. The class implements the transactional interaction patterns specified for OData services that support draft documents and provides methods for draft-specific actions, for example validate, prepare, activate. Additionally, it handles transactional request processing, ensures concurrency control and correct ETag handling. It provides access to the simple interaction patterns of runtime handling for drafts according to the draft specification. These can be combined as required by client applications. Additionally, error handling is provided to notify client implementations of error situations. The event fatalError is thrown, if fatal errors occur during execution of OData requests.

prepareDraftEntity.!description: Submits changes to the back-end and prepares an existing draft entity in the back-end for later activation by invoking the preparation action.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

getDraftContext.!description: Returns the current draft context instance. If no instance exists, it is created lazily.

getDraftForActiveEntity.!description: Retrieves a possibly existing draft entity for the given active entity using the binding context of the active entity from the back-end.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The binding context of the active entity

validateDraftEntity.!description: Submits changes to the back-end and prepares an existing draft entity in the back-end for later activation by invoking the validation action.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Na.!description:
Creates a new NavigationHandler class by providing the required environment.
The NavigationHandler supports the verification of sensitive information. All properties that are part of selectionVariant and valueTexts will be verified if they are annotated as com.sap.vocabularies.PersonalData.v1.IsPotentiallySensitive or com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ExcludeFromNavigationContext and will be removed before the data is persisted as the app state.
Also, all properties annotated as com.sap.vocabularies.Analytics.v1.Measure will be removed from the data stored as the xapp state.
To verify the information to be removed, the NavigationHandler requires an unnamed model of type {@link sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel} on component level. It is possible to set such a model using the setModel method.
Note: The check for excluded data requires that the OData metadata has already been loaded completely.
If the OData metadata model has not been loaded completely, all properties are removed from the application context.
Note: This class requires that the UShell {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation} is available and initialized.

navigate.!description: Triggers a cross-app navigation after saving the inner and the cross-app states. Since 1.52.0 the navigation mode based on sap-ushell-next-navmode is taken into account. If set to explace the inner app state will not be changed. Note: The sNavMode argument can be used to overwrite the SAP Fiori launchpad default navigation for opening a URL in-place or ex-place.
navigate.!type: fn(sSemanticObject: String, sActionName: String, vNavigationParameters?: Object | String, oInnerAppData?: Object, fnOnError?: fn(), oExternalAppData: Object, sNavMode?: String)

parameters.oExternalAppData: type: object, description: Object for storing the state which will be forwarded to the target component.
parameters.sNavMode: type: string, description: Argument is used to overwrite the FLP-configured target for opening a URL. If used, only the explace or inplace values are allowed. Any other value will lead to an exception NavigationHandler.INVALID_NAV_MODE.
parameters.sSemanticObject: type: string, description: Name of the semantic object of the target app
parameters.sActionName: type: string, description: Name of the action of the target app
parameters.fnOnError: type: function, description: Callback that is called if an error occurs during navigation
parameters.vNavigationParameters: type: object|string, description: Navigation parameters as an object with key/value pairs or as a string representation of such an object. If passed as an object, the properties are not checked against the IsPotentialSensitive or Measure type.
parameters.oInnerAppData: type: object, description: Object for storing current state of the app

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler.

constructContextUrl.!description: The method creates a context url based on provided data. This context url can either be used as {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler#setParameterContextUrl ParameterContextUrl} or {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler#setFilterContextUrl FilterContextUrl}

parameters.oModel: type: sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel, description: used for url determination. If omitted, the NavigationHandler model is used.
parameters.sEntitySetName: type: string, description: used for url determination

parseNavigation.!description: Parses the incoming URL and returns a Promise. If this method detects a back navigation, the inner app state is returned in the resolved Promise. Otherwise startup parameters will be merged into the app state provided by cross app navigation, and a combined app state will be returned. The conflict resolution can be influenced with sParamHandlingMode defined in the constructor.

storeInnerAppState.!description: Changes the URL according to the current app state and stores the app state for later retrieval.

parameters.mInnerAppData: type: object, description: Object containing the current state of the app
parameters.bImmediateHashReplace: type: boolean, description: If set to false, the inner app hash will not be replaced until storing is successful; do not set to false if you cannot react to the resolution of the Promise, for example, when calling the beforeLinkPressed event

setTechnicalParameters.!description:
Sets the application specific technical parameters. Technical parameters will not be added to the selection variant passed to the application. As a default the following values are considered as technical parameters:
  • sap-system
  • sap-ushell-defaultedParameterNames
  • "hcpApplicationId"

parameters.aTechnicalParameters: type: array, description: list of parameter names to be considered as technical parameters. null or undefined may be used to reset the complete list.

mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant.!description: Combines the given parameters and selection variant into a new selection variant containing properties from both, with the parameters overriding existing properties in the selection variant. The new selection variant does not contain any parameters. All parameters are merged into select options. The output of this function, converted to a JSON string, can be used for the {@link #.navigate NavigationHandler.navigate} method.
mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant.!type: fn(mSemanticAttributes: Object, sSelectionVariant: String, iSuppressionBehavior?: Number) -> Object

parameters.mSemanticAttributes: type: object, description: Object containing key/value pairs
parameters.iSuppressionBehavior: type: int, description: Indicates whether semantic attributes with special values (see {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.SuppressionBehavior suppression behavior}) must be suppressed before they are combined with the selection variant; several {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.SuppressionBehavior suppression behaviors} can be combined with the bitwise OR operator (|)
parameters.sSelectionVariant: type: string, description: The selection variant in string format as provided by the SmartFilterBar control

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

storeInnerAppStateWithImmediateReturn.!description: Changes the URL according to the current app state and stores the app state for later retrieval.

parameters.mInnerAppData: type: object, description: Object containing the current state of the app
parameters.bImmediateHashReplace: type: boolean, description: If set to false, the inner app hash will not be replaced until storing is successful; do not set to false if you cannot react to the resolution of the Promise, for example, when calling the beforeLinkPressed event. Note:If not provided it will be treated as set to false. Note:If set to true, the calling instance has to ensure that a follow-on call to replaceHash will take place!

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Na.!helpDescription:
Creates a new NavigationHandler class by providing the required environment.
The NavigationHandler supports the verification of sensitive information. All properties that are part of selectionVariant and valueTexts will be verified if they are annotated as com.sap.vocabularies.PersonalData.v1.IsPotentiallySensitive or com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ExcludeFromNavigationContext and will be removed before the data is persisted as the app state.
Also, all properties annotated as com.sap.vocabularies.Analytics.v1.Measure will be removed from the data stored as the xapp state.
To verify the information to be removed, the NavigationHandler requires an unnamed model of type {@link sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel} on component level. It is possible to set such a model using the setModel method.
Note: The check for excluded data requires that the OData metadata has already been loaded completely.
If the OData metadata model has not been loaded completely, all properties are removed from the application context.
Note: This class requires that the UShell {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation} is available and initialized.

getTechnicalParameters.!description:
Gets the application specific technical parameters. Technical parameters will not be added to the selection variant passed to the application. As a default the following values are considered as technical parameters:
  • sap-system
  • sap-ushell-defaultedParameterNames
  • "hcpApplicationId"

setModel.!description: Sets the model that is used for verification of sensitive information. If the model is not set, the unnamed component model is used for the verification of sensitive information.

parameters.oModel: type: sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel, description: for checking sensitive information

replaceHash.!description: Changes the URL according to the current sAppStateKey. As an reaction route change event will be triggered.

parameters.sAppStateKey: type: string, description: the new app state key.

processBeforeSmartLinkPopoverOpens.!description:
Processes navigation-related tasks related to beforePopoverOpens event handling for the SmartLink control and returns a Promise object. In particular, the following tasks are performed before the SmartLink popover can be opened:
  • If mInnerAppData is provided, this inner app state is saved for back navigation at a later time.
  • The table event parameters (semantic attributes) and the selection variant data are combined by calling the method {@link #.mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant}.
  • The combined data is saved as the cross app state to be handed over to the target app, and the corresponding sap-xapp-state key is set in the URL.
  • All single selections ("including equal") of the combined selection data are passed to the SmartLink popover as semantic attributes.
  • The method oTableEventParameters.open() is called. Note that this does not really open the popover, but the SmartLink control proceeds with firing the event navigationTargetsObtained.
processBeforeSmartLinkPopoverOpens.!type: fn(oTableEventParameters: Object, sSelectionVariant: String, mInnerAppData?: Object, oExternalAppData?: Object) -> Object

parameters.oExternalAppData: type: object, description: Object containing the state which will be passed to the target screen.
parameters.mInnerAppData: type: object, description: Object containing the current state of the app. If provided, opening the Popover is deferred until the inner app data is saved in a consistent way.
parameters.oTableEventParameters: type: object, description: The parameters made available by the SmartTable control when the SmartLink control has been clicked, an instance of a PopOver object
parameters.sSelectionVariant: type: string, description: Stringified JSON object as returned, for example, from getDataSuiteFormat() of the SmartFilterBar control

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.Transacti.!description: Assuming state-less communication, each single data modification request (or change set in an OData $batch request) is a "mini-transaction", which saves data to the database. The class allows you to submit changes, invoke actions, OData CRUD operations in general, and trigger client-side validations. It ensures concurrency control and correct ETag handling. The class gives access to runtime draft handling for applications. Additionally error handling capabilities are provided to notify client implementations of error situations. The event fatalError is thrown, if fatal errors occur during execution of OData requests.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.TransactionController.

destroy.!description: Frees all resources claimed during the life-time of this instance.

editEntity.!description: Prepares an entity for editing. If the entity is active and draft enabled, a new draft document is created. If not, the control is automatically returned to the caller of the method by returning a resolved promise.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context
parameters.bPreserveChanges: type: boolean, description: Set to true to avoid the creation of a new draft when unsaved changes exist in the back-end

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.TransactionController with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.BaseController.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.Transacti.!constructorDescription: Constructor for a new transaction controller instance.

resetChanges.!description: Resets changes that have been tracked by the current instance of sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODatatModel. These changes have been created by invoking the setProperty method of sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODatatModel.

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.Transacti.!helpDescription: Assuming state-less communication, each single data modification request (or change set in an OData $batch request) is a "mini-transaction", which saves data to the database. The class allows you to submit changes, invoke actions, OData CRUD operations in general, and trigger client-side validations. It ensures concurrency control and correct ETag handling. The class gives access to runtime draft handling for applications. Additionally error handling capabilities are provided to notify client implementations of error situations. The event fatalError is thrown, if fatal errors occur during execution of OData requests.

deleteEntity.!description: Submits changes to the backend system and deletes an entity in the backend system. This entity can be either a draft or an active entity.
deleteEntity.!type: fn(vEntity: sap.ui.model.Context | String, mParameters: map) -> Promise

parameters.vEntity: type: sap.ui.model.Context|string, description: Binding context or path of the entity
parameters.mParameters: type: map, description: Parameters that control the behavior of the request

deleteEntities.!description: Submits changes to the backend system and deletes a group of entities in the backend system. These entities can be both draft or active entities.

parameters.aEntities: type: array, description: Binding contexts or paths (strings) which identify the entities
parameters.mParameters: type: map, description: Parameters that control the behavior of the request

getDraftController.!description: Returns the current draft controller instance.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.TransactionController with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.BaseController.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.Transacti.!type: fn(oModel: sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel, oQueue: sap.ui.generic.app.util.Queue, mParams: map)

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Pa.!description: A static enumeration type which indicates the conflict resolution method when merging URL parameters into select options

URLParamWins.!description: The conflict resolution favors the URL parameters over the SelectionVariant. Caution: In case of cross-app navigation a navigation parameter value from the source app is overwritten by a default, if a default is maintained in the launchpad designer for this parameter in the target app!

InsertInSelOpt.!description: The conflict resolution adds URL parameters to the SelectionVariant

SelVarWins.!description: The conflict resolution favors the SelectionVariant over URL parameters

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftCont.!description: The class provides access to information on draft handling that is available in the OData service's metadata as it interprets draft-specific annotations.

hasDraft.!description: Checks whether an entity set is draft-enabled. The entity set name is derived from the given binding context

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftContext.

destroy.!description: Frees all resources claimed during the life-time of this instance.

isDraftEnabled.!description: Checks whether a given entity set is draft-enabled.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set

isDraftRoot.!description: Checks whether a given entity set is a draft root.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set

hasPreserveChanges.!description: Checks if the parameter "PreserveChanges" is supported by the edit function. If the edit action is triggered with the parameter set to true the ABAP application infrastructure will respond with HTTP response code 409 if unsaved changes (from another user) exist.

getODataDraftFunctionImportName.!description: Returns the name of the function import to be used.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context
parameters.sDraftFunctionImport: type: string, description: The draft function import

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftContext with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

hasDraftRoot.!description: Checks whether an entity set is draft root. The entity set name is derived from the given binding context.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftCont.!helpDescription: The class provides access to information on draft handling that is available in the OData service's metadata as it interprets draft-specific annotations.

getSemanticKey.!description: Returns the semantic keys for a given entity set.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The given entity set

hasDraftValidationFunction.!description: Checks whether an entity set has a draft validation function. The entity set name is derived from the given binding context.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

hasSiblingEntity.!description: Checks whether a sibling entity for a given entity set is available.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set

isTechnicalKey.!description: Checks whether a given key is a technical key.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set
parameters.oKeys: type: object, description: The given key

checkUpdateOnChange.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 undefined
Checks whether an OData property is annotated with UpdateOnChange. The method is used in context of a validation success event.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set
parameters.sProperty: type: string, description: The name of the property

hasDraftAdministrativeData.!description: Checks whether administrative data for a given draft is available.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set

isSemanticKey.!description: Checks whether a given key is a semantic key.

parameters.sEntitySet: type: string, description: The name of the entity set

hasDraftPreparationAction.!description: Checks whether an entity set has a draft preparation action. The entity set name is derived from the given binding context.

parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Pr.!description: Creates a new instance of a PresentationVariant class. If no parameter is passed, an new empty instance is created whose ID has been set to "". Passing a JSON-serialized string complying to the Selection Variant Specification will parse it, and the newly created instance will contain the same information.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.PresentationVariant.

getContextUrl.!description: Gets the current context URL intended for the query.

toJSONString.!description: Serializes this instance into a JSON-formatted string.

getText.!description: Returns the current text / description of this selection variant.

getProperties.!description: Gets the more trivial properties. Basically all properties with the exception of the Visualization.

setProperties.!description: Sets the more trivial properties. Basically all properties with the exception of the Visualization.

parameters.mProperties: type: map, description: properties to be used.

isEmpty.!description: Returns true if the presentation variant does not contain any properties. nor ranges.

getID.!description: Returns the identification of the selection variant.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.PresentationVariant with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

parameters.sURL: type: string, description: The URL of the context

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Pr.!helpDescription: Creates a new instance of a PresentationVariant class. If no parameter is passed, an new empty instance is created whose ID has been set to "". Passing a JSON-serialized string complying to the Selection Variant Specification will parse it, and the newly created instance will contain the same information.

parameters.mProperties: type: map, description: to be used for the table visualization.

setID.!description: Sets the identification of the selection variant.

parameters.sId: type: string, description: The new identification of the selection variant

toJSONObject.!description: Returns the external representation of the selection variant as JSON object.

parameters.mProperties: type: map, description: to be used for the chart visualization.

setText.!description: Sets the text / description of the selection variant.

parameters.sNewText: type: string, description: The new description to be used

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Su.!description: A static enumeration type which indicates whether semantic attributes with values null, undefined or "" (empty string) shall be suppressed, before they are mixed in to the selection variant in the method {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler.mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant} of the {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler NavigationHandler}

ignoreEmptyString.!description: Semantic attributes with an empty string are ignored, the remaining attributes are mixed in to the selection variant. Warning! Consider the impact on Boolean variable values!

standard.!description: Standard suppression behavior: semantic attributes with a null or an undefined value are ignored, the remaining attributes are mixed in to the selection variant

raiseErrorOnUndefined.!description: Semantic attributes with an undefined value lead to an {@link sap.fin.central.lib.error.Error error} of type NavigationHandler.INVALID_INPUT

raiseErrorOnNull.!description: Semantic attributes with a null value lead to an {@link sap.fin.central.lib.error.Error error} of type NavigationHandler.INVALID_INPUT

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavError with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.

parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavError.

sap.ui.generic.app.!description: SAPUI5 library that provides generic reuse functionality which can be used by Applications.
sap.ui.generic.app.!helpDescription: SAPUI5 library that provides generic reuse functionality which can be used by Applications.

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Na.!description: A static enumeration type which indicates the type of inbound navigation

initial.!description: Initial startup without any navigation or default parameters

URLParams.!description: Basic cross-app navigation with URL parameters only (without sap-xapp-state) or initial start with default parameters

xAppState.!description: Cross-app navigation with sap-xapp-state parameter (and URL parameters), defaulted parameters may be added

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.SelectionVariant with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.ApplicationController.

registerGroupChange.!description: Registers a change for the given group id.

parameters.sGroupId: type: string, description: The group id where changes were done

destroy.!description: Frees all resources claimed during the life-time of this instance.

getNewActionContext.!description: Creates a context for an action call (OData function import)
getNewActionContext.!type: fn(sFunctionName: String, oEntityContext: Object, mParameters: map) -> map

parameters.sFunctionName: type: string, description: Name of the function import that shall be triggered.
parameters.oEntityContext: type: object, description: The given binding context of the object on which the action is called.
parameters.mParameters: type: map, description: Parameters to control the behavior of the request.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.ApplicationController with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.BaseController.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

executeSideEffects.!description: Executes annotated side effects for properties/navigation properties or navigation entities. If no properties or entities are passed the unspecified side effect is executed. This unspecified side effect uses either the annotated targets of the unspecified side effect or - in case of no available annotation - triggers a complete model refresh on the OData model.
executeSideEffects.!type: fn(oContext: sap.ui.model.Context, aSourceProperties: Array, aSourceEntities: Array, bForceGlobalRefresh: Boolean) -> Promise

parameters.aSourceProperties: type: array, description: An array of properties of the given context or properties in a 1:1 association for those side effects shall be executed. Can be undefined.
parameters.oContext: type: sap.ui.model.Context, description: The given binding context
parameters.bForceGlobalRefresh: type: boolean, description: If not explicitly set to false a global model refresh is triggered.
parameters.aSourceEntities: type: array, description: An array of entities (navigation properties) with the side effects that shall be executed. Can be undefined.

propertyChanged.!description: Notifies the application controller of a change of a property. Please note that the method is not meant for productive use currently. It is experimental.

parameters.sPath: type: string, description: The path to the changed property
parameters.oContext: type: object, description: The binding context in which the change occured

getTransactionController.!description: Returns the current transaction controller instance.

invokeActions.!description: Invokes an action for every provided context where the properties are taken as input from. The changes are submitted directly to the back-end.
invokeActions.!type: fn(sFunctionName: String, aContexts: Array, mParameters: map) -> Promise

parameters.aContexts: type: array, description: The given binding contexts where the parameters of the action shall be filled from.
parameters.sFunctionName: type: string, description: The name of the function or action that shall be triggered.
parameters.mParameters: type: map, description: Parameters to control the behavior of the request.

registerView.!description: Registers the given view with the Application Controller.

parameters.oView: type: sap.ui.core.mvc.View, description: The view to be registered

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.ApplicationController with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.BaseController.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

addSelectOption.!description: Adds a new range to the list of select options for a given parameter.
addSelectOption.!type: fn(sPropertyName: String, sSign: String, sOption: String, sLow: String, sHigh?: String) -> Object

parameters.sHigh: type: string, description: Set only if sOption is BT: the upper boundary of the interval; must be undefined or null in all other cases
parameters.sOption: type: string, description: The option of the range (EQ for "equals", NE for "not equals", LE for "less or equals", GE for "greater or equals", LT for "less than" (and not equals), GT for "greater than" (and not equals), BT for "between", or CP for "contains pattern" (ABAP-styled pattern matching with the asterisk as wildcard)
parameters.sLow: type: string, description: The single value or the lower boundary of the interval; the null value is not allowed
parameters.sSign: type: string, description: The sign of the range (Include or Exclude)
parameters.sPropertyName: type: string, description: The name of the property for which the selection range is added

getSelectOption.!description: Returns the set of select options/ranges available for a given property name.

parameters.sPropertyName: type: string, description: The name of the property for which the set of select options/ranges is returned

setParameterContextUrl.!description: Sets the context URL intended for the parameters.

parameters.sURL: type: string, description: The URL of the parameter context

addParameter.!description: Sets the value of a parameter called sName to the new value sValue. If the parameter has already been set before, its value is overwritten.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: The name of the parameter to be set; the null value is not allowed
parameters.sValue: type: string, description: The value of the parameter to be set

renameParameter.!description: Renames a parameter called sNameOld to sNameNew. If a parameter or a select option with the name sNameNew already exist, an error is thrown. If a parameter with the name sNameOld does not exist, nothing is changed.

parameters.sNameNew: type: string, description: The new name of the parameter
parameters.sNameOld: type: string, description: The current name of the parameter to be renamed

getPropertyNames.!description: Returns the names of the parameter and select option properties available for this instance.

toJSONObject.!description: Returns the external representation of the selection variant as JSON object.

getParameterContextUrl.!description: Gets the current context URL intended for the parameters.

removeParameter.!description: Removes a parameter called sName from the selection variant.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: The name of the parameter to be removed

getParameter.!description: Returns the value of the parameter called sName if it has been set. If the parameter has never been set or has been removed, undefined is returned.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: The name of the parameter to be returned

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Se.!description: Creates a new instance of a SelectionVariant class. If no parameter is passed, an new empty instance is created whose ID has been set to "". Passing a JSON-serialized string complying to the Selection Variant Specification will parse it, and the newly created instance will contain the same information.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.SelectionVariant.

toJSONString.!description: Serializes this instance into a JSON-formatted string.

getText.!description: Returns the current text / description of this selection variant.

isEmpty.!description: Returns true if the selection variant does neither contain parameters nor ranges.

setFilterContextUrl.!description: Sets the context URL intended for the filters.

parameters.sURL: type: string, description: The URL of the filters

getID.!description: Returns the identification of the selection variant.

massAddSelectOption.!description: Adds a set of select options to the list of select options for a given parameter.

parameters.sPropertyName: type: string, description: The name of the property for which the set of select options is added
parameters.aSelectOptions: type: array, description: Set of select options to be added

getSelectOptionsPropertyNames.!description: Returns the names of the properties available for this instance.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.SelectionVariant with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getValue.!description:
First tries to retrieve the set of select options/ranges available for sName as property name. If successful, this array of selections is being returned. If it fails, an attempt to find a parameter, whose name is sName, is made. If the latter succeeds, the single value is converted to fit into an array of selections to make it type compatible with ranges. This array is then returned.
If neither a select option nor a parameter could be found, undefined is returned.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: The name of the attribute for which the value is retrieved

sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.Se.!helpDescription: Creates a new instance of a SelectionVariant class. If no parameter is passed, an new empty instance is created whose ID has been set to "". Passing a JSON-serialized string complying to the Selection Variant Specification will parse it, and the newly created instance will contain the same information.

getFilterContextUrl.!description: Gets the current context URL intended for the filters.

getParameterNames.!description: Returns the set of parameter names available in this selection variant

setID.!description: Sets the identification of the selection variant.

parameters.sId: type: string, description: The new identification of the selection variant

removeSelectOption.!description: Removes a select option called sName from the selection variant.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: The name of the select option to be removed

renameSelectOption.!description: Renames a select option called sNameOld to sNameNew. If a select option or a parameter with the name sNameNew already exist, an error is thrown. If a select option with the name sNameOld does not exist, nothing is changed.

parameters.sNameNew: type: string, description: The new name of the select option property
parameters.sNameOld: type: string, description: The current name of the select option property to be renamed

setText.!description: Sets the text / description of the selection variant.

parameters.sNewText: type: string, description: The new description to be used
